column4: hi all, trying to upgrade a dapper box to edgy, getting 404's... I've edited sources.list to point to old-releases but do-release-upgrade still fails with the 'getting prerequisites failed' error. /var/log/dist-upgrade/main.log has 404's in it for archive.ubuntu.com
I tried just putting old-releases IP as archive.ubuntu.com in /etc/hosts but no joy
both of those are no longer supported
it appears do-release-upgrade still points to archive.ubuntu.com and not old-releases so it blows up
I can do it the debian way and just change it to hardy in sources.list but I would rather do it the 'right' way with do-release-upgrade
sorry I just realise I said edgy and not hardy in my initial question
the upshot of my question is "what is the right way to go dapper to hardy" now that dapper is EOL
I can do it the debian way but I just wonder if there is a ubuntu way to handle it
I can't be the only person with this problem, there are a ton of old dapper machines out there still
I will pastebin it one sec
why didn't you update when dapper was supported?
not my machine, thanks for asking
its my guess that the url it is pointing to no longer exists
thanks, I got that from the 404 error
